comment.text: This translation key is used for a suggested customization message in a payment plan settings section. It appears as a tooltip on a payment plan selection element and provides instructions to customize the chosen plan.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The variable {{planName}} appears correctly in both the English and Bulgarian versions.

While "Přizpůsobte si svůj tarif {{planName}}" is understandable, a more natural and accurate translation of "Customize your {{planName}} plan" would be something like "Upravte si svůj tarif {{planName}}" or "Personalizujte svůj tarif {{planName}}". "Přizpůsobte" implies a broader adaptation, while "upravte" or "personalizujte" better convey the customization aspect of a plan.

The German translation uses a hyphen (-) to connect 'Plan' to the `planName` variable. While technically correct, it might be more natural to use 'Ihr {{planName}} Plan' (your {{planName}} plan) for better readability and flow in German.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Passen Sie Ihren Ihr {{planName}} Plan an

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation uses a semicolon instead of a space before the {{planName}} variable. While understandable, a space would be more natural in Greek.

While 'ohjelmaa' can mean 'plan', in this context referring to a subscription or service tier, 'suunnitelmaa' would be a more accurate and natural translation of 'plan'. 'Ohjelmaa' typically refers to a program or show.

While 'Personnalisez' is correct for 'Customize', 'plan tarifaire' is overly literal and can sound clunky in French. A more natural translation would be something like 'Personnalisez votre abonnement' or 'Personnalisez votre forfait'.

The translation 'Gestionați abonamentul dvs {{planName}}' is a functional equivalent but not the most natural or direct translation of 'Customize your {{planName}} plan'. 'Customize' implies tailoring or adjusting, whereas 'Gestionați' (manage) is broader. A better translation might be 'Personalizați-vă planul {{planName}}' or 'Adaptați-vă planul {{planName}}'.
The word 'අභිරුචිකරණය' (abiruchikaranya) is a valid term for 'customize' but it's a bit formal for the context of a business suggestion.  A more conversational option might be better.

The word 'Прилагоди' is a valid translation for 'Customize,' but a more natural and common translation for this context would be 'Изузе' (Izuze). 'Прилагоди' can imply adjusting something already existing, while 'Изузе' emphasizes creating a custom plan.

The translation "自定义您的{{planName}}版本" doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "Customize your {{planName}} plan." "版本" (version) implies a different iteration of the plan, while "Customize" refers to personalizing or modifying the existing plan.  It's also a bit clunky.
